title: Graceful boots

properties.name: description
properties.value: The graceful boots are part of the graceful outfit, costing 40 marks of grace from Grace in the Rogues' Den. When worn, they reduce weight by 4kg and increase the rate of the player's natural run energy restoration by 3%. When worn with the rest of the outfit, the rate is increased to 30%. It can be stored in a magic wardrobe in a player owned house.

SMW Subobject for ShayzienHigh Alchemy value: 24Examine: For your graceful feet.Is members only: trueIs variant of: Graceful bootsUses infobox: ItemImage: File:Graceful boots (Shayzien).pngWeight: -4.000Value: 40Version anchor: ShayzienRelease date: 4 February 2016Item ID: 13626

The graceful boots are part of the graceful outfit, costing 40 marks of grace from Grace in the Rogues' Den. When worn, they reduce weight by 4kg and increase the rate of the player's natural run energy restoration by 3%. When worn with the rest of the outfit, the rate is increased to 30%. It can be stored in a magic wardrobe in a player owned house.

Although the boots of lightness are easily obtained and reduce weight by 4.5 kg (compared to 4 kg of the Graceful boots), the Graceful boots are needed for the full outfit's effect, which increases the run energy restore rate by 30%. With this in mind, it is most practical to buy the boots last if buying pieces of the Graceful clothing set one-by-one.

Players who have 100% favour in a House of Great Kourend can use their graceful boots on Osten to recolour it to a House's colours for 15 marks of grace, or a pure white colour if they have 100% favour in all Houses.

Alternatively, they may have it recoloured dark blue by speaking to Pirate Jackie the Fruit for 250 agility arena tickets (this requires having the full set).

Or, they may have it recoloured Dark by using dark dye purchasable from Mysterious Stranger for 300 hallowed marks.

Trivia[edit | edit source]

  • The wings on the boots are likely a reference to the ancient Greek/Roman god Hermes/Mercury, the messenger of the gods.

Trailblazer Launch |members = Yes |quest = No |tradeable = No |placeholder = No |equipable = Yes |stackable = No |noteable = No |options = Wear |destroy = Drop |destroy10 = Dismantle |examine = For your graceful feet. |value = 40 |weight = -4.000 |id1 = 11861 |id2 = 13590 |id3 = 13602 |id4 = 13614 |id5 = 13626 |id6 = 13638 |id7 = 13678 |id8 = 21078 |id9 = 24760 |id10 = 25086 }} }} {{Synced switch |version1 = [[File:Graceful boots detail.png|left|140px]] |version2 = [[File:Graceful boots (Arceuus) detail.png|left|140px]] |version3 = [[File:Graceful boots (Piscarilius) detail.png|left|140px]] |version4 = [[File:Graceful boots (Lovakengj) detail.png|left|140px]] |version5 = [[File:Graceful boots (Shayzien) detail.png|left|140px]] |version6 = [[File:Graceful boots (Hosidius) detail.png|left|140px]] |version7 = [[File:Graceful boots (Kourend) detail.png|left|140px]] |version8 = [[File:Graceful boots (Agility Arena) detail.png|left|140px]] |version9 = [[File:Graceful boots (Hallowed) detail.png|left|140px]] |version10 = [[File:Graceful boots (Trailblazer) detail.png|left|140px]] }} The '''graceful boots''' are part of the [[graceful outfit]], costing 40 [[marks of grace]] from [[Grace]] in the [[Rogues' Den]]. When worn, they reduce [[weight]] by 4kg and increase the rate of the player's natural [[run energy]] restoration by 3%. When worn with the rest of the outfit, the rate is increased to 30%. It can be stored in a [[magic wardrobe]] in a player owned house. Although the [[boots of lightness]] are easily obtained and reduce weight by 4.5 kg (compared to 4 kg of the Graceful boots), the Graceful boots are needed for the full outfit's effect, which increases the run energy restore rate by 30%. With this in mind, it is most practical to buy the boots '''last''' if buying pieces of the Graceful clothing set one-by-one. Players who have 100% favour in a House of [[Great Kourend]] can use their graceful boots on [[Osten]] to recolour it to a House's colours for 15 marks of grace, or a pure white colour if they have 100% favour in all Houses. Alternatively, they may have it recoloured dark blue by speaking to [[Pirate Jackie the Fruit]] for 250 [[agility arena ticket]]s (this requires having the full set). Or, they may have it recoloured Dark by using [[dark dye]] purchasable from [[Mysterious Stranger (Hallowed Sepulchre)|Mysterious Stranger]] for 300 [[hallowed mark]]s. {{Infobox Bonuses |version1 =
